title: How to Make Jello Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper or grease.
Combine the butter, sugar, gelatin, eggs and vanilla in a mixing bowl and beat the ingredients on medium speed using a spatula, a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment.
Whisk together the flour, baking powder and salt in a separate mixing bowl.
Add 1/2 cup of the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients while mixing at medium speed.
steps.description: You can also hand-mix if preferred.

steps.headline: Continue adding the dry ingredients in 1/2-cup increments until the dry ingredients are thoroughly incorporated.
Scoop out enough dough to roll the dough into a ball with a diameter of 1-1/2" (4 centimeters) using clean hands or a spoon.
Place the balls of dough onto the baking sheet as you work through the batch.
Place a fork over the top of each cookie and press downward with the tines.
steps.description: This will create a four-row pattern in the center of the cookie, just like the one traditionally used when making peanut butter cookies.

steps.headline: Turn your fork 90 degrees until it is perpendicular with the first impression.
steps.description: Press down a second time, creating a crisscross pattern.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies for 15 minutes or until you see a golden brown ring forming near the base of the cookies.
Remove the cookies from the oven and cool for 2 minutes before using a spatula to move the cookies to wire racks.
steps.description: Enjoy these cookies with a side of whipped cream!

text: Making the Dough Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper or grease.  Combine the butter, sugar, gelatin, eggs and vanilla in a mixing bowl and beat the ingredients on medium speed using a spatula, a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment.  Whisk together the flour, baking powder and salt in a separate mixing bowl.  Add 1/2 cup of the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients while mixing at medium speed. You can also hand-mix if preferred. Continue adding the dry ingredients in 1/2-cup increments until the dry ingredients are thoroughly incorporated.  Shaping the Dough Scoop out enough dough to roll the dough into a ball with a diameter of 1-1/2" (4 centimeters) using clean hands or a spoon.  Place the balls of dough onto the baking sheet as you work through the batch.  Place a fork over the top of each cookie and press downward with the tines. This will create a four-row pattern in the center of the cookie, just like the one traditionally used when making peanut butter cookies. Turn your fork 90 degrees until it is perpendicular with the first impression. Press down a second time, creating a crisscross pattern. Baking the Jello Cookies Bake the cookies for 15 minutes or until you see a golden brown ring forming near the base of the cookies.  Remove the cookies from the oven and cool for 2 minutes before using a spatula to move the cookies to wire racks. Enjoy these cookies with a side of whipped cream!
